substeps.title: Wash hands
substeps.description: Wash your hands carefully, then use alcohol gel on them.
substeps.moreInfo: If unsure, first check out the instruction guide ''Wash Your Hands for IV Treatment''

substeps.title: Clean space
substeps.description: Clean your work area (or the blue tray if you have one) with a wipe. Dry it with a clean paper towel. Then wipe again with a disinfecting wipe and let it dry for at least 30 seconds.
substeps.moreInfo: A clean, dry surface helps protect the PICC line from bacteria. Avoid preparing on cloth or uneven surfaces.

substeps.title: Set up towel
substeps.description: Place your dressing towel on the work area. If using a dressing pack, open it and remove the towel. Only touch the corners.

substeps.title: Clean hands again
substeps.description: Use alcohol gel on your hands again before touching any sterile items.

substeps.title: Take out flushes
substeps.description: Take the saline flush(es) out of their packaging and place them on your clean work area.

substeps.title: Remove air from syringes
substeps.description:
Remove air from the saline syringes:
• Take off the white cap.
• Gently push the saline until you see it at the top of the syringe.
• Put the white cap back on until ready.
• Do this for each flush.
• Close all clamps on your IV line and on the device tubing (if it has one).
substeps.moreInfo: Removing air is essential to avoid introducing bubbles. Close all clamps before disconnecting to prevent leaks.

substeps.title: Clean and disconnect
substeps.description:
Open an alcohol wipe.
• Disconnect the device from your IV line.
• Clean the end of your IV line thoroughly using a scrubbing motion. Let it dry for 30 seconds.
substeps.moreInfo: Scrub well and don’t rush the drying time — this is a key infection control step.

substeps.title: Flush PICC line
substeps.description:
Use the saline syringe to flush your line using a slow push-pause method.
• Re-cap with the blue cap when done.
• Dispose of the used device in the waste bin provided by your nurse.
substeps.moreInfo: Push-pause method: Gently push about 2 ml of saline at a time, then pause. Repeat like you’re pumping. You should have flushed a total of 20 ml of saline.

substeps.title: Clean up and wash hands
substeps.description: Wash your hands again or use alcohol gel. Clean up the area and throw away any used materials.
substeps.moreInfo: Place sharps and used materials in your provided bin — never in household waste. Ask your nurse if unsure.
